RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 12700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MAY 24, 2023. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAGICAL EXPRESS gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the five path on the turn, left the turn outside and steadily gained to take over late yards. BE BE BOP set a pressured pace from the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled leaving the turn, but gave up the lead in late yards. CHARITABLY GIFTED pressured the pace through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path and ran evenly in the lane. DAN THE MAN CAN had a brief early lead then pressured the pace from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the turn off the rail and ran evenly in the stretch. JAZZ MAN DO chased through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. MACY'S BOY saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Magical Express
ENTRY.OWNER: Pesaturo Gus Joy Kevin J and McMahon Michael H

ENTRY.NAME: Be Be Bop
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,dug in lane,caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Dan the Man Can
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief early lead,chased 7/16,dropped back mid turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Charitably Gifted
ENTRY.OWNER: Shepherd Robert Phillips Jason and Harrison Glenn N

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 54. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JLODIAMOND took the lead nearing the half mile pole and showed the way through the backstretch, came under pressure toward the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was kept alert in the stretch. ANOTHER FINE JUBA chased, raced off the rail on the turn and settled for second best. SPECIAL KAYLEE gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail, was steadily handled in the lane and held on for third. GHOSTLY ANNA gave chase, raced near the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. SYMPTOMATIC chased the early pace outside then saved ground on the turn. FRIEND FURH REAL gave chase, raced in the four path on the turn and showed little in the lane. BUTTERFLY WORLD broke a step slow and never factored. Bull's Legacy became fractious in the gate and was a late scratch.

ENTRY.NAME: Butterfly World
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Jlodiamond
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside,pressured 1/4,rail turn,kept alert lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 13700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MAY 24, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since May 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowe d 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BUBBA G chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail, dug in from the head of the lane and dueled clear under the wire. STEVETHEVANDRIVER took the lead on the chute then tapered in and rated the pace, came under pressure toward the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled in the lane, but gave up the lead in later yards. PEPE AND HEYWOOD chased through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn, angled to the outside entering the stretch and dug in to take third the final strides. BIG HAMBONE gave chase between horses through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path, drifted nearing the head of the lane and flattened stride the final sixteenth. WIDGET FACTORY chased through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn, moved in entering the stretch but flattened stride late yards. HE IS BONAFIDE stumbled to his nose leaving the gate then gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. SEVEN AND SEVEN gave chase and rounded the turn about the five path.

ENTRY.NAME: Bubba G
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,off rail turn,dug in lane,up later yards,clear wire

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Lantern Hill Farm LLC & Lighthouse Group LLC

ENTRY.NAME: He Is Bonafide
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled break,chased,off rail turn,little in lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 76. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MR. DUMBLEDORE settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole and steadily improved from that point, rounded the turn in the three path and dug in determinedly to eke out the edge over SHOOT THE BREEZE in the final yards. The latter raced with the pace inside, dueled nearing the three eighths pole, contested the edge nearest the rail on the far turn, and put Break The Chains away midway on the far turn, dug in to the stretch challenge of Mr. Dumbledore leaving the turn but relented in the final yards. DANTE'S INFERNO saved ground well off the early pace, raced at the rail on the far turn, eased out leaving the turn and came along for third the final strides. LOVE IS WICKED became a bit fractious in the gate then rated close inside, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, closed to a boxed in position at the rail approaching the eighth pole then flattened the final sixteenth. BREAK THE CHAINS raced with the pace two deep then dueled toward the three eighths pole, contested at a close disadvantage into the turn but dropped back midway through the turn and weakened. SEABROOK ISLAND came out and made contact with I'MLIVINGTHEDREAM leaving the gate then rounded the first turn about the four path, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole but weakened into the far turn. The latter became a bit fractious in the gate and was bumped at the break, raced well back two deep on the opening turn and showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Dante's Inferno
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,rail turn,bid nearing 1/4,along 3rd final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Seabrook Island
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,4p 1st turn,chased 7/16,weakened into far turn

ENTRY.NAME: I'mlivingthedream
ENTRY.OWNER: Mountain View Racing LLC and Golden Melinda B

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BURR HILL BULLET stalked two deep then challenged approaching the quarter pole, contested at a close disadvantage two deep on the far turn, dug in for the nod mid-stretch and raced clear later yards. CURB THAT TIGER saved ground off the pace, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, eased outward mid-stretch and dueled through the final yards for second. ASTRAYAL raced off the rail the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn about the three path, raced evenly in the lane and was outfinished for second the final yards. I SEE NOTHING rounded the first turn in the four path, gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. JOOBY DOOBY DOO rated a short lead inside, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, contested the edge nearest the rail on the far turn but weakened mid-stretch. HILLBILLY ROCK saved ground on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but showed little response. SUGAR LIPS was never a factor. CHARTERED COURSE was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Jooby Dooby Doo
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 7/16,edge rail far turn,weakened 1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 63. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LINDA'S TAJ set a clear pace inside, came under pressure nearing the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the turn and was kept sharp in the lane. GOLDEN STAR chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn, came between horses leaving the eighth pole and finished evenly to clear second inside the sixteenth pole. KIMSFAVORITESTORM ducked in and made contact with Raggedy leaving the gate then gave chase, raced in range of the lead in the three path on the turn then dug in through the lane to hold third. AZTECA GIRL chased outside, rounded the turn about the five path and ran evenly in the lane. RAGGEDY was bumped inward and into Makaan leaving the gate then gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the six path and ran evenly in the stretch. MALTESE ROSE chased inside, eased to the five path midway on the turn and flattened from mid-stretch. MAKAAN bobbled and was bumped shortly after the start then gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. TIZZ THE G gave chase and weakened in the three path on the turn. CATAFFAIRWITHMEDAL gave early chase toward the outside then weakened while saving some ground on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Linda's Taj
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear pace inside,pressured 1/4,rail turn,kept sharp lane

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Star
ENTRY.OWNER: Arnold Doug Seale Richard M and Campbell David

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 61. Claiming Purse 17600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Wh ere Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SCARE DEM saved ground off the pace, started a bid leaving the half mile pole, raced at the rail into the far turn, angled to the four path entering the stretch and dug in to get up the final yards. ONE CANDY CASTLE stalked from the three path the opening turn, closed to the lead past the seven sixteenths and contested the edge at the rail on the far turn, dug in to hold off IRISH FLIGHT through the lane but was outfinished in the final yards. The latter settled in the three path the first turn, bid leaving the three eighths pole, contested at a close disadvantage two deep on the far turn then outfinished in the stretch duel for second. RED HOT TODDY steadied at the break then saved ground, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn then flattened in the lane. COMEONTURNMELOOSE raced off the rail the first turn then eased out into the backstretch, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and showed little more. MONKEY WRENCH took a quick lead and showed the way inside, was met past the seven sixteenths pole and gave chase from that point, but faded on the far turn. LAURA'S GRAND stalked two deep on the first turn, gave chase into the backstretch but faded past the three eighths pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Monkey Wrench
ENTRY.COMMENT: quick lead,rated pace,met past 7/16,chased,faded far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Scare Dem
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid past 1/2,rail turn,angled 4p 1/8,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Comeonturnmeloose
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,eased out 1/2,chased 7/16,4p far turn,little in lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 35. Maiden Claiming Purse 13000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GREY FLAMINGO pressured the pace through the backstretch and raced close in the three path on the turn, took the lead nearing mid-stretch and edged away later yards. MSSNAP set a pressured pace through the backstretch, rounded the turn at the rail but was met nearing mid-stretch and relented from that point. SWISS HORIZON pressured the pace inside, raced close off the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. VIESTE gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn then flattened stride. JUNIPER GRACE became edgy in the gate and broke a step slow, picked up the chase leaving the half mile pole, rounded the turn about the four path and finished evenly. RUMORGOINGAROUND gave chase outside, rounded the turn about the five path and ran evenly in the lane. BIT OF BLESSINGS gave chase, rounded the turn near the rail and showed little in the lane. LIME STAR gave chase inside then faded at the rail on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Swiss Horizon
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace inside,close off rail turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Juniper Grace
ENTRY.COMMENT: edgy in gate,step slow break,chased,4p turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Grey Flamingo
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,close 3p turn,up near 1/16,edged away later yards
